Introduction to Bartron-Myer Funeral Home Inc

Located in the heart of Montrose, Pennsylvania, Bartron-Myer Funeral Home Inc has been a trusted and compassionate provider of funeral services for generations. With a rich history and a commitment to excellence, this family-owned funeral home has earned a reputation for delivering personalized and dignified ceremonies that honor the lives of loved ones. In this article, we will delve into the history, services, and amenities offered by Bartron-Myer Funeral Home Inc, providing you with a comprehensive understanding of what sets them apart from other funeral homes in the area.

A Legacy of Compassion and Care

Founded on a foundation of compassion and care, Bartron-Myer Funeral Home Inc has been serving the Montrose community since [year]. The funeral home's legacy is built on a deep understanding of the importance of honoring the deceased and supporting those who are grieving. Over the years, the staff at Bartron-Myer has developed a reputation for their kindness, empathy, and attention to detail, making them the go-to choice for families in need of funeral services.

Maria Anna Cavallaro - November 11, 1936 - March 30, 2024

Departed: 03/30/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: Maria Anna Cavallaro, 87, of Montrose, PA, passed away, Saturday, March 30, 2024. Born November 11, 1936, in Palermo, Sicily, the daughter of Giovanni and Rosa (DiSalvo) Baiamonte. Maria Anna came to the United States at the age of 25. Maria Anna worked alongside her husband in several businesses for over 50 years. She was an active member of Holy Name of Mary Catholic Church. Maria Anna enjoyed attending her Bible study group, her gardening, sewing, raising chickens and had an abundant collection of pig figurines. Survivors include her husband of 62 years, Ignazio Cavallaro; two daughters, Theresa (Jeffrey) Lakin, Stuart, FL, and Roxanne (Mario) Meza of Freehold, NJ; and son, Eric (Maria) Cavallaro of Stuart, FL; 8 grandchildren: Marisa, Christopher, Maria Gabriella, Emanuele, Marco, Isaac, Isabella and Isaiah and great-grandchild Damien. She is survived by her brother Giacomo Baiamonte of Sicily. She was predeceased by her parents, and her sisters Francesca and Giroloma and her brother Francesco as well as her son Salvatore. Kenneth W. Laurie - April 02, 1950 - March 06, 2024

Departed: 03/06/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: Kenneth William Laurie Endwell, NY Kenneth William “Zip” Laurie, of Endwell, NY, 73, died Wednesday morning at the Bridgewater Center for Rehabilitation and Nursing Binghamton New York after a long battle with cancer. He was born on April 2, 1950, in Binghamton, NY, to the late Kenneth G Laurie and Elizabeth M. (Tiffany) Laurie. He was a graduate of Mountain View High School, Kingsley, PA. He received an A.B. in Geography from Syracuse University and an M.A. in Geography from Western Illinois University. He was a PhD candidate in the Department of Geography, University of Illinois, specializing in landform evolution in northeastern PA completing his field research in the mountains around Noxen, PA. He was an Assistant Professor of Geography and Geology at Eastern Illinois University and later an Assistant Professor of Geography and Planning at East Carolina University. He joined the Carpenter’s Union in 1967, and then served as the Project Manager for the former Kenneth G. Laurie Inc., a general contracting operation in New York’s Southern Tier working in IBM and numerous government and school facilities. For many years he owned and operated an Environmental Consulting company and later became a Sewage Enforcement Officer for townships throughout Northeastern PA and the Council of Governments in New Milford, PA Over the years, “Zip” enjoyed family hunting trips to the Poconos and Noxen, PA, as well as a recent hunting trip to Idaho. He enjoyed playing golf and was also an avid supporter of Syracuse University Athletics and was a season ticket holder for men’s football and basketball. Go Cuse! Most of all he was an academic and read everything he could get his hands on. He loved storytelling and having conversations about history, politics and current events. He talked regularly of going back to a university to study a multitude of disciplines. Survivors include sisters Lynnette Laurie Millard of Harford, PA, Barbara Konsur of Brooklyn, PA, Donna and Fred Cobb of Dundaff, PA; nephews and nieces and their spouses, Jeremy Konsur of Mt. Cobb, PA; Amy Thomas of Alford, PA, Bradley and Paula Millard of Harford, PA, Heidi Millard of Queens, NY, Nicholas and Erin Cobb of Louisville, KY; Matthew and Tara Cobb of Dundaff, PA, Tiffany Cobb Keating and James of Dundaff, PA, Fred Cobb IV of Dundaff, PA; and numerous great nieces and nephews. Pallbearers: Jeremy Konsur Alexander Konsur Bradley Millard Nicholas Cobb Matthew Cobb Fred Cobb IV Graveside Services: 10:00 am, Saturday, March 16, 2024, at Peck Cemetery, Harford, PA 18823. Visitation: 6:00-8:00 pm on Friday, March 15 at Bartron Myer Funeral Home 382 Church Street, Montrose, PA Instead of Flowers: Memorial contributions may be made to the Harford Historical Society, 4158 Creek Road, Kingsley, PA 18826

Alma J. Blaisure - November 03, 1929 - March 05, 2024

Departed: 03/05/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: Alma J. Blaisure of Montrose, PA Alma J. Blaisure, 94, of Montrose, PA passed away at home, Tuesday, March 5, 2024. Born November 3, 1929, in Montrose, PA, the daughter of the late Leon Carlton and Mabel Amy (Sivers) Raynor. Her husband John Joseph “Jack” Blaisure predeceased her in 1980. Alma was employed as a dietary aide and cook for 30 years by the Montrose General Hospital and then the Endless Mountains Health Systems. An avid reader, Alma also enjoyed card and board games, playing bingo, spending time with her family, and traveling. Over the years, she liked baking raspberry, apple, and cherry pies and banana bread which visiting family members often shared with their friends and colleagues to their delight. She was on the membership roll of the First Presbyterian Church in Montrose. Survivors include her daughter Cheryl Wellman, son David James Blaisure and daughter Karen R. Blaisure, grandchildren; Kara (Steve), Brandy (Joe), Shawn and Todd (Allison), 8 great-grandchildren and 2 great-great grandchildren; her sister Rosalie Raynor of Montrose, PA; sisters-in-law; and nieces and nephews. In addition to her husband and parents, her brothers Carlton and Lawrence and 2 great-grandchildren predeceased her. Pallbearers: Todd Wellman, Aiden Wellman, Shawn Blaisure, Nickolas Blaisure, Damien Riley, Alex Riley, and Joe Riley Services: Saturday, March 9, 2024, at 1:00 PM at Bartron Myer Funeral Home, 382 Church Street, Montrose, PA Visitation: one hour prior till time of service at the Funeral Home Kindly consider a memorial contribution to either the United Fire Company or the Montrose Minute Men.

Isaac Levi Harris - December 19, 1990 - March 05, 2024

Departed: 03/05/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: Isaac “Levi” Harris was born December 19th 1990 and passed away March 5th, 2024. Levi’s parents, Mark and Karen Harris, had the honor of watching him grow into the loving husband and proud father that he became. His brother, Sam, had the pleasure of growing up with him enjoying many hobbies together such as quading, hunting, and a love for guns and knives. He truly was a wonderful son and brother. Levi married Hannah Smoker on April 27, 2014. They had over 9 wonderful years of marriage. In that 9 years they built a beautiful family together which includes Avah, Harper, Coleson, Easton and Trace. Levi adored his family and loved spending time with them. Whether it was making s’mores around a fire pit or sitting on the couch holding one of his new born babies, Levi will always be remembered for his caring love towards them. Levi has many nieces and nephews whom he loved very much. His brother’s family (Sam and Callin Harris) include Logan and Oliver. Hannah’s sister’s family (Jessie and Jamie Holbert) include Abigail, Benjamin, Jackson, Emily, and Annalise. Levi’s paternal grandparents include Herb and Carolyn Harris and maternal grandmother Pearl Hunsberger. His maternal grandfather, Edward Hunsberger, predeceased him. Levi graduated from Pennsylvania College of Technology in Williamsport, PA with an engineering degree and pursued a career in the field. He worked at Lockheed Martin in Owego NY, as the Manufacturing Project Manager. While Levi will be greatly missed, we find peace and comfort in God’s promise that we will see him again. Levi was a born-again believer, saved at a young age, who loved God and led his family to follow His word. John 3:16 Services: 1:00 pm, Tuesday, March 12, 2024, at CalTab Church, 729 Main Street, Vestal, NY The family will receive friends and family following the service. Herbert was employed as an Inspector by the former Bendix Aviation Corp in South Montrose. He served his country in the United States Army. Herbert's decision to accept Jesus Christ as his Savior in 1964 effected the rest of his life. As a longtime member of Springville Baptist, he served in numerous capacities including 25+ years as custodian. For more than 5 years he enjoyed serving with his late wife counseling the 1st and 2nd graders at Elk Lake Elementary School, telling them of Jesus’ love and pointing them to Him. He served on the board of the Susquehanna County Chapter of Child Evangelism Fellowship. Herbert was the last of his immediate family. His survivors include his son Mark (Marjorie) Gaylord of Springville, PA, his daughter Amy (Gregory) Kapp of Stroudsburg, PA; 7 grandchildren; Mariah (Matt), Micah, Martin, Marianna, Michael, Brian and Jeffrey; great granddaughters; Felicity and Nyla; nieces and nephews. Rev. Harold Carr Craige - October 20, 1938 - January 24, 2024

Departed: 01/24/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: Rev. Harold Carr Craige, 85, of Montrose, PA, passed away on Wednesday, January 24, 2024 in his home, surrounded by his family. Born October 20, 1938, in Meshoppen, PA, the son of Thomas Houston and Ruth Inez Palmer Craige II. Harold was born in Meshoppen, PA where he grew up with his late brother Thomas Houston Craige III. He was an Eagle Scout with the Boy Scouts of America and graduated from Elk Lake High School where his mother Ruth taught in a one-room schoolhouse. He left Susquehanna County to attend Pennsylvania State University, graduating in 1960 in Psychology and furthered his education at Boston University, graduating in 1963 with a Masters in Divinity. Rev. Craige was ordained to the ministry in 1963 and served within the Scranton Wyoming Conference in various churches for several years. It was at the Court Street United Methodist Church in Scranton, Pa where he met his wife of 57 years, Gloria. Harold and Gloria spent the rest of their married lives taking care of others. They operated several personal care homes for those who needed special care including the Welsh Women's Home on Capouse Avenue, which later was a Personal Care Home, and The Methodist Home on Green Ridge Street, in West Scranton, PA. Harold, who sometimes would forget to run his lofty ideas past his wife, Gloria, decided to return to Susquehanna County and purchase the former Auburn Rush Poor Asylum in 1988. They operated their personal care home, Grandmother’s House, there for over 20 years where they continued to raise their family. Harold served in the Unitarian Universalist Church in Brooklyn, PA, for over 17 years after moving to Susquehanna County. For those that knew Harold, you knew once he set his mind to something, it became his passion. Whether it was reading, puzzles, genealogy, amateur heavy equipment operator or even making homemade goat cheese. He loved sharing his interests with his friends and family. You could be sure he would share his latest findings or factoid when you would call or visit. Harold was a collector of memories - he kept every trinket, greeting card, picture, sermon, and planner. He found great joy in being surrounded by his children and grandchildren. Later in life, Harold poured his free time into being the Secretary of Meshoppen High Alumni and a member of the Penn State Alumni Association. He spent many hours at the Susquehanna County Historical Society and Free Library doing genealogy research. Survivors include his wife of over 57 years, Gloria Casparro Craige; four daughters; Carisa (Charles) Keller of Woodbridge, VA, Darinda (Dean) Cesario of West Grove, PA, Miranda (Lawrence) McElroy of Wilmington, DE, and Noelle Craige of Perkasie, PA; six sons, Nathanael Craige of Campbell, NY, Aaron (Requel) Craige of Montrose, PA, Justin (Christal) Craige of Pasadena, MD, Brandon Craige of Newark, DE, Michael Craige, Joshua Craige; sister-in-law, Shirley Craige of Snow Hill, MD; 15 grandchildren, 1 great grand-daughter; along with many nieces, nephew, and cousins. Harold is the last of his immediate family. Services: Private If desired, memorial contributions may be made to either the Susquehanna County Historical Society and Free Library Association or the Unitarian Universalist Church, Brooklyn, PA.

She was a member of Springville United Methodist Church. Barbara loved her church family and filled many roles there; teaching Sunday School, singing in the choir, serving on the Board of Trustees, helping with community breakfasts, and being the Financial Secretary for over 65 years. She also served with the Republican Women, was a member of the former C-Club, and served as the Springville Township Judge of Elections. Barbara also loved knitting, was an avid reader, and enjoyed working on puzzles. She also enjoyed camping and spending her winters in her Florida “dollhouse.” Barbara was the last of her immediate family. Her survivors include two daughters, Lisa (Bill) Searles of Westport, MA, and Karen Ricci (Rob Hunter) of Springville, PA; two Sons, Reid A. (Andrea Ganino) Squier of Somerville, MA, and Neil S. DeWitt Reynolds - September 11, 1936 - January 23, 2024

Departed: 01/23/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: For God so loved the world that He gave His Only begotten Son, that whosoever believes on Him shall not perish, but have everlasting life. John 3:16 F. DeWitt Reynolds went home to be with his Lord and Savior, Tuesday, January 23, 2024, at Allied Hospice, Scranton, PA following a lengthy battle with Alzheimer’s disease. DeWitt was born in Montrose, PA on September 11, 1936, the son of Clyde and Alice (DeWitt) Reynolds. DeWitt grew up in New Milford and graduated from Hallstead High School. After high school he served two-years in the U.S. Army. After his discharge he worked for Crowley's in Binghamton, NY. In 1960, he started his long-time career with the Prudential Insurance Company for 36 years. DeWitt obtained several insurance designations throughout his career, CLU, LUTCF and was District Manager in Troy, NY and Binghamton, NY retiring in 1996. In his younger days he was a member of the Boy Scouts. DeWitt had a love for learning and was always adding to his qualifications. He also had a passion for golf and spent each winter in his home in Sebring, Florida. DeWitt was a member of Tall Pines Golf Club. DeWitt's family includes his beloved wife of 35 years, Joanne Newton Reynolds. His children are his daughter, Maribeth (John) Low of Wilmington, DE; two sons, Dr. David D. (Katherine) Reynolds of Honesdale, PA, and Daniel L. (Lisa) Reynolds of Ulster, PA; step-daughter, Debbie Jo (Steven Potter) Fulmer of Towanda, PA; step-son, Daniel S. (Chantel) Fulmer of Sugar Run, PA; 6 grandchildren; Ethan, Evan, Bethany (Cody), Gustin, India and Daniel; 7 step-grandchildren; Joshua (Ashlee), Danielle (Nick), Megan (Justin), Jordan (Danielle), Justin (Erica), Hunter and Samuel; 4 step-great grandsons; sister, Mary Alice Daniels of Rotonda West, FL; brother, William (Martha) Reynolds of Kirklwood, NY; and many nieces and nephews. DeWitt's family extends their deepest appreciation to his caregivers: Kelly Myers, Stephanie Blowers, Heidi Sisson, Nora Wait, and Katrina Anderson for their wonderful care. For more information or directions please go to www.BartronMyer.com. Glendora L. Graham - October 17, 1932 - January 02, 2024

Departed: 01/02/2024 (Montrose)

Obituary Preview: Our beloved Mother and friend, Glendora Lorraine (Bunnell) Graham changed her address to Heaven unexpectedly surrounded by her loving children on January 2, 2024, to meet the arms of her loving Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ. Born into a Christian family, daughter of the late Mavis (Cronk) and Ralph Bunnell on October 17, 1932 in Fairdale, PA. Glendora came to know Jesus as her personal Savior at the age of 12. After graduating from Rush High School in 1950, she graduated from Baptist Bible Seminary in Johnson City, NY in 1953. She married the love of her life, Reverend Bernard A. Graham on June 26, 1954. Reverend Graham went home to be with the Lord on July 18, 2011. The Lord blessed Glendora and Bernard with 3 children: David Graham (Birchardville, PA), Doreen Bowles (Newfield, NY), and Wendy Graham-Cranmer (Little Meadows, PA); 8 grandchildren: Brendon Graham (Mary), Molly Graham (Nick), Nathan Bowles (Jamie), Natalie Vorhis (Edward), Jamie Sechrist (Ricardo), Alexander, Whitney, and Gabrielle Cranmer; and 9 Great-Grandchildren: David and Isaiah Graham, Brandon and Brian Graham, Clara Graham, Lily and Isabella Vorhis, Rowan Bowles and MacKenzie Brown. She also leaves behind her beloved sister, Donna Johnson and brother, Denny (Janis) Bunnell. She is predeceased by her grandson, Brian Graham and her sister, Shirley Bennett. Glendora answered the call of the Lord with her husband pastoring two churches in the Elk Lake and East Bridgewater Communities. There she taught Sunday School, Junior Church, and was always mentoring others. She also loved to cook huge meals, entertain guests at her home and watching “her” birds while sitting on the patio. One of her favorite verses from Proverbs 3:5-6 “Trust in the Lord with all thine heart and lean not unto thine understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct thy steps.” With her faith in Jesus, every moment of joy in her life was telling and leading others to him. Our Mother, Grandmother, and Great-Grandmother has completed her assignment here on earth and is now rejoicing in Heaven with her Lord and Savior. She treasured her family and friends and she will be greatly missed by all. Services: 1:00 pm, Saturday, January 13, 2024, at Birchardville Baptist Church, 49 Birchardville Hill Rd. Montrose, PA Visitation: 6:00 – 8:00 pm on Friday, January 12 at Bartron-Myer Funeral Home, 382 Church Street, Montrose, PA Interment: Immediately following services at Birchardville Cemetery

Frequently Asked Questions

What is an obituary?

An obituary is a written notice that announces the death of a person, typically including their name, age, date of birth and death, and a brief biography. It is usually published in a newspaper, online obituary platform, or funeral home website to inform friends, family, and community members of the passing.

What is the purpose of an obituary?

The primary purpose of an obituary is to notify others of a person's passing and provide information about their life, achievements, and surviving family members. It also serves as a way to honor and celebrate the deceased person's life.

Who writes an obituary?

Typically, the family of the deceased person writes the obituary, often with the assistance of a funeral home or obituary writer. In some cases, a friend or colleague may also write an obituary.

What information should be included in an obituary?

A typical obituary includes the person's name, age, date of birth and death, place of residence, occupation, education, hobbies, achievements, and surviving family members. It may also include information about funeral services, memorial donations, and condolences.

How long should an obituary be?

The length of an obituary can vary depending on the publication or platform. Generally, it should be concise and to the point, ranging from a few sentences to a few paragraphs.

Can I include photos in an obituary?

Yes, many publications and online platforms allow you to include one or more photos with the obituary. This can be a great way to personalize the tribute and help readers remember the deceased person.

How do I submit an obituary to a newspaper?

Contact the newspaper's obituary department directly to inquire about their submission process and deadlines. Some newspapers may have online forms or email addresses for submitting obituaries.

Can I publish an obituary online only?

Yes, there are many online platforms that allow you to publish an obituary without printing it in a physical newspaper. These platforms often offer additional features such as guest books, condolence messages, and photo galleries.

How much does it cost to publish an obituary?

The cost of publishing an obituary varies depending on the publication or platform. Some newspapers charge by the word or line, while others offer package deals or flat fees. Online platforms may offer free or low-cost options.

In most cases, it is possible to make corrections or updates to an obituary after it has been published. Contact the publication or platform where the obituary was published to request changes.

How long does it take for an obituary to be published?

The timeframe for publishing an obituary varies depending on the publication or platform. Some newspapers may publish same-day or next-day, while others may take several days. Online platforms often publish immediately.

Can I include quotes or lyrics in an obituary?

Yes, including meaningful quotes or lyrics can add a personal touch to an obituary and help capture the essence of the deceased person's personality or spirit.

Should I include funeral service details in the obituary?

Yes, it's common to include information about funeral services, visitation hours, and burial arrangements in the obituary so that friends and family can attend and pay their respects.

Can I include charitable donation information in an obituary?

Yes, many families choose to include information about charitable donations in lieu of flowers or other gifts. This can be a meaningful way to honor the deceased person's legacy.

How do I handle sensitive or private information in an obituary?

If you're unsure about including certain information in an obituary, it's best to err on the side of caution and omit it. You can always share more personal details at funeral services or through private communication with close friends and family.

Can I write an obituary for someone who has been deceased for a long time?

Yes, it's never too late to write an obituary for someone who has passed away. This can be a therapeutic way to process your grief and celebrate their life.

Are there any specific guidelines for writing an obituary for a veteran?

Yes, when writing an obituary for a veteran, it's common to include information about their military service, awards, and honors. You may also want to include details about any military funeral honors or burial arrangements.

How do I find inspiration for writing an obituary?

You can find inspiration by thinking about the deceased person's personality, accomplishments, and relationships. You can also look at examples of other obituaries online or seek guidance from a funeral home or professional writer.

Is it appropriate to include humor in an obituary?

Yes, incorporating humor into an obituary can be a great way to celebrate the deceased person's personality and spirit. Just be sure to keep it respectful and tasteful.

Can I include stories or anecdotes in an obituary?

Yes, sharing personal stories or anecdotes can add depth and meaning to an obituary. These can be especially helpful in capturing the essence of the deceased person's personality or character.
